verse.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
verse.verse_1: Say, "It was revealed to me that a band of jinn listened in, and said, 'We have heard a wondrous Quran.
verse.verse_2: It guides to rectitude, so we have believed in it; and we will never associate anyone with our Lord.
verse.verse_3: And Exalted is the Grandeur of our Lord-He never had a mate, nor a child.
verse.verse_4: But the fools among us used to say nonsense about God.
verse.verse_5: And we thought that humans and jinn would never utter lies about God.
verse.verse_6: Some individual humans used to seek power through some individual jinn, but they only increased them in confusion.
verse.verse_7: They thought, as you thought, that God would never resurrect anyone.
verse.verse_8: We probed the heaven, and found it filled with stern guards and projectiles.
verse.verse_9: We used to take up positions to listen in; but whoever listens now finds a projectile in wait for him.
verse.verse_10: We do not know whether ill is intended for those on earth, or if their Lord intends goodness for them.
verse.verse_11: Some of us are righteous, but some of us are less than that; we follow divergent paths.
verse.verse_12: We realized that we cannot defeat God on earth, and that we cannot escape Him by fleeing.
verse.verse_13: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. Whoever believes in his Lord fears neither loss, nor burden.
verse.verse_14: Among us are those who are submitting, and among us are the compromisers. As for those who have submitted-it is they who pursue rectitude.
verse.verse_15: But as for the compromisers-they will be firewood for Hell.'"
verse.verse_16: Had they kept true to the Path, We would have given them plenty water to drink.
verse.verse_17: To test them with it. Whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will direct him to torment ever mounting.
verse.verse_18: The places of worship are for God. So do not call, besides God, upon anyone else.
verse.verse_19: And when the servant of God got up calling on Him, they almost fell on him in a mass.
verse.verse_20: Say, "I pray only to my Lord, and I never associate anyone with Him."
verse.verse_21: Say, "It is not in my power to harm you, nor to bring you to right conduct."
verse.verse_22: Say, "No one can protect me from God, and I will not find any refuge except with Him.
verse.verse_23: Except for a proclamation from God and His messages. He who defies God and His Messenger-for him is the Fire of Hell, in which they will dwell forever."
verse.verse_24: Until, when they see what they were promised, they will know who is weaker in helpers, and fewer in numbers.
verse.verse_25: Say, "I do not know whether what you are promised is near, or whether my Lord will extend it for a period."
verse.verse_26: The Knower of the Invisible; He does not disclose His Invisible to anyone.
verse.verse_27: Except to a Messenger of His choosing. He then dispatches guards before him and behind him.
verse.verse_28: That He may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses what they have, and has tallied everything by number.
